author: Renata
content: In Bengaluru, the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrests seven individuals, dismantling an illicit elephant tusk trade syndicate. The breakthrough occurred when three suspects were intercepted, leading to the seizure of 6.8 kg of ivory tusks. DRI utilizes enhanced powers under recent Wildlife Protection Act amendments to combat wildlife trafficking.
title: DRI Operation Thwarts Elephant Ivory Smuggling Syndicate

author: Rupesh
content: Mohammed Asfan, a 30-year-old from Hyderabad, was tragically killed after being duped into joining the Russian military for the war against Ukraine, as confirmed by the Indian Embassy in Moscow. Deceived by a Dubai-based agent through a YouTube channel, Asfan's case highlights the dangers of fraudulent job promises abroad. About 20 Indians are reportedly working with the Russian military.
title: Hyderabad man killed after Russian army job scam

author: Sakshita Khosla
content: Family of 69-year-old KP Sivaraman, who died by consuming poison at the EPFO office in Kerala's Kochi, has taken legal action against the officials. "They waited for him to die to give back what was his life's savings," said his son Pradheesh. Sivaraman's PF claim was rejected for nine years and the payment was made after he died last month.
title: They waited for his death to release money: Son of man who consumed poison at EPFO office

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: PM Modi shares a glimpse of his Srinagar visit, admiring the majestic Shankaracharya Hill from a distance. The iconic landmark, steeped in cultural significance, captivates with its natural beauty. PM Modi's acknowledgment underscores the region's rich heritage and scenic allure, inviting visitors to explore its timeless charm.
title: PM Modi views the majestic Shankaracharya Hill during his visit

author: Subhangi Singh
content: Former judge of Calcutta HC, Abhijit Gangopadhyay, joined BJP on Thursday in the presence of state party chief Sukanta Majumdar, LoP Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders. Gangopadhyay resigned from the post of judge on Tuesday. "I am joining the BJP as it is a national party, fighting against the corruption of the TMC in Bengal," he said after resigning.
title: Ex-Calcutta HC judge Abhijit Gangopadhyay joins BJP

author: Shreya Sur
content: India's position in the Indo-Pacific region has strengthened and the country's armed forces are equipped to retaliate against any disturbance, according to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. "India has never been an aggressor, but we are ready for handling any disturbance," Singh said at the NDTV Defence Summit.
title: Indian forces equipped to respond to any situation: Rajnath Singh

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: In a video uploaded by the BCCI on its social media handle, former Indian opener Sunil Gavaskar was seen cutting a cake to celebrate the 37th anniversary of him completing 10,000 runs in Tests. Gavaskar achieved the feat in Ahmedabad against Pakistan on his way to 63 off 170 deliveries.
title: Video: Gavaskar cuts cake on 37th anniversary of scoring 10k runs

author: Kamna Revanoor
content: On Tuesday, 27 February, the Supreme Court chided the Union government for its inability to specify a range of rates for accessing services at private hospitals and clinical establishments and sought immediate amends. However, healthcare providers say the rates proposed may not align with the actual costs incurred by hospitals, leading to potential closures due to financial constraints.
title: Why private hospitals, IMA oppose standarised healthcare rates

author: The Hawk Editor
content: PM Modi visits Srinagar, unveiling projects worth over Rs 6,400 crore to boost economy and tourism. His first trip since Article 370's abrogation includes tributes to soldiers, stringent security, and initiatives under 'Swadesh Darshan' and 'PRASHAD'. Modi also meets new government employees and beneficiaries.
title: PM Modi will unveil Rs 6,400 crore projects in Srinagar

author: Renata
content: Aasare Hospital owner in Nelamangala, Bengaluru Rural, Ravikumar NR, faces charges for allegedly conducting 74 illegal abortions without proper authorization and maintaining inaccurate records. The case, dating back to 2021, was filed on February 20, and the accused, Ravikumar NR, is reportedly absconding.
title: Hospital Owner Charged with Conducting 74 Illegal Abortions
